remarks: Define the class of all universal vertices (in graphs).  A vertex is called universal if it is adjacent, i.e. connected by an edge, to all other vertices (of the graph).  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Oct-2017.)
statement:
df-uvtx $p |- UnivVertex = ( v e. _V , e e. _V |-> { n e. v | A. k e. ( v \ { n } ) { k , n } e. ran e } ) $.
$d e k n v $.
